structure.unit: LICENSING OF MOTOR VEHICLES, OPERATORS, AND TRAILERS

law.catch_line: Use of original hospital birth certificate as proof of applicant's age.
law.text: For the purposes of KRS 186.400 to 186.640, an original hospital birth certificate signed by the attending physician shall be acceptable as certifying the birth date of an applicant for an instruction permit or operator's license.
law.history: Created 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 287, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1998.
